de.waldheinz.fs.fat
Class Utils

java.lang.Object
  de.waldheinz.fs.fat.Utils

public class Utils
extends Object

Contains some utility methods which are mainly useful for debugging purposes.

Author:
Matthias Treydte <waldheinz at gmail.com>

Method Detail

hexOffset

public static String hexOffset(int value,
                               int width)
                        throws IllegalArgumentException
Converts a integer value to an hex string which will have the specified width.

Parameters:
value - the value to be converted to a hex string
width - the desired width of the output string
Returns:
the string representation of the value
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the value is too big for the specified width
See Also:
Integer.toHexString(int)

getChar

public static char getChar(byte b)
Returns the char corresponding to the specified byte.

Parameters:
b - the byte to convert to a char
Returns:
the char for the specified byte, or '.' if the byte corresponds to no (printable) character

hexDump

public static void hexDump(PrintStream ps,
                           ByteBuffer bb)
Prints a hex dump of the specified ByteBuffer to the specified PrintStream. Only the "remaining" bytes in the buffer are printed. The byte buffer is not modified by this method (i.e. no bytes from the buffer are "consumed").

Parameters:
ps - the print stream to write the hex dump to
bb - the byte buffer to be hex-dumped
